speaker: Alojz Peterle (PPE-DE). –
english:
Alojz Peterle (PPE-DE). – (ES) Madam President, Commissioner, ladies and gentlemen, as a Member of Parliament who was not born in the Iberian Peninsula, one minute is sufficient for me to express my conviction that the current level of cooperation between the European Union and Latin America does not reflect the interests of the countries and the citizens of both parties.
I am very pleased with the excellent report by Mr Salafranca, by means of which the European Parliament is demonstrating its contribution to the political will required for the strong and genuine development of strategic relations.
I would like to stress that this development benefits the whole of the European Union, not just a few of its members.
Finally, I believe that not only are bilateral relations with individual countries or with Mercosur or the Andean Community important, but also relations with the whole of Latin America.
original:
Alojz Peterle (PPE-DE). – (ES) Señora Presidenta, señora Comisaria, estimados colegas, como diputado que no ha nacido en la Península Ibérica, un minuto me alcanza para expresar mi convicción de que el actual nivel de cooperación entre la Unión Europea y América Latina no refleja los intereses de los países y de sus ciudadanos en ambas partes.
Estoy muy contento con el excelente informe del colega Salafranca, con el cual el Parlamento Europeo asegura su parte de la voluntad política necesaria para el fuerte y verdadero desarrollo de las relaciones estratégicas.
Quisiera recalcar que este desarrollo beneficia a toda la Unión Europea, no solamente a algunos de sus miembros.
Por último, creo que no solo son importantes las relaciones bilaterales con los países individualmente o con el Mercosur o la Comunidad Andina, sino también con toda América Latina.
agenda_item: A stronger partnership between the European Union and Latin America (debate)
summary_english:
{
"headline": "Current EU-Latin America cooperation insufficient, strategic relations should benefit entire EU not just select members",
"issueSum": "The speaker raises the issue that the current level of cooperation between the European Union and Latin America does not adequately reflect the interests of countries and citizens on both sides. He emphasizes the need for stronger strategic relations that benefit the entire EU, not just certain member states.",
"positionSum": "The speaker strongly supports strengthening EU-Latin America relations and endorses the Salafranca report. He advocates for comprehensive relations that include not only bilateral arrangements with individual countries or regional blocs like Mercosur and the Andean Community, but also relations with Latin America as a whole.",
"argSum": "The speaker argues that enhanced EU-Latin America cooperation would benefit all EU member states, not just those with historical ties to Latin America (implicitly referring to Spain and Portugal). He suggests that the current cooperation level fails to serve the mutual interests of both regions.",
"propSum": "The speaker supports the Salafranca report as a means to demonstrate Parliament's contribution to developing strategic relations. He advocates for a comprehensive approach that includes bilateral relations with individual countries, regional blocs, and Latin America as a whole.",
"quotes": ["the current level of cooperation between the European Union and Latin America does not reflect the interests of the countries and the citizens of both parties", "this development benefits the whole of the European Union, not just a few of its members", "not only are bilateral relations with individual countries or with Mercosur or the Andean Community important, but also relations with the whole of Latin America"]
}
